message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get a fantastic deal. I'm willing to sell it to you for $11,500. What do you think?
Alice, your offer is close, but I can't go above $10,500. That's my absolute maximum.  Let's see if we can make this work.

Thanks for your offer, Bob! I understand you're trying to be reasonable. However, I have to think about my own costs and profit margins. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our offers. I can sell the product to you for $11,000. What do you think?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  However, $11,000 is still a bit out of my range. I'm prepared to pay $10,750. Let's see if we can close this deal.

I understand your concerns, Bob, and I appreciate your persistence. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can sell the product to you for $10,900. That's as low as I'm willing to go. What do you think?
Alice, I'm getting close to my limit, but I can't go higher than $10,800. Let's make this happen. If we can't agree on this price, I'll have to consider other options.

Bob, I understand your concerns, but I'm getting a bit frustrated with the back-and-forth. I'm willing to make one more concession, but it's my last one. I can sell the product to you for $10,850. That's the absolute lowest I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
